CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 15, 1966, pg. 13A reads: "Rainbow Cotillion - One of the holiday season's prettiest affairs was a Rainbow Cotillion in the ballroom of the George Washington Hotel in Washington, Pa. The event was sponsored by the Civic League of Washington and proceeds aided the Lemoyne Community Center.  Miss Myra Campbell (seated with armful of flowers) reigned as "Queen."  She was crowned by last year's "Queen," Miss Lydia Bennett, Miss Donna Kenn on the new "Queen's" right assisted with the coronation.  Pretty debutantes and their escorts pictured are: Frances Spencer and Paul Panton, Diane Hargrove and Herbie Walls, Loraine Walls and Rodney Patterson, Belinda Tucker and Gregory Patterson, Noel Vactor and Douglas Williams; Madeline Lillard and Keith Hammond, Elaine Frazier and Ross Davenport, and Marsha Saunders and Tony Hawthorne.  Miss Campbell's escort was Reginald Brown.  Miss Bennett was escorted by Michael Lewis."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of "Queen" Myra Campbell, seated, being crowned by Lydia Bennett and Donna Kenn, surrounded by debutantes and escorts, including Frances Spencer and Paul Panton, Diane Hargrove and Herbie Walls, Loraine Walls and Rodney Patterson, Belinda Tucker and Gregory Patterson, Noel Vactor and Douglas Williams, Madeline Lillard and Keith Hammond, Elaine Frazier and Ross Davenport, and Marsha Saunders and Tony Hawthorne, in George Washington Hotel for Rainbow Cotillion, Washington, Pennsylvania
